title: Saudi stocks plunge after weekend attack on oil plants
text:
Saudi stocks plunge after weekend attack on oil plants

Stock Markets 21 minutes ago (Sep 15, 2019 08:31)

DUBAI (Reuters) - Saudi stocks ( ) opened 2.3% lower on Sunday, reacting to news of attack on two plants at the heart of the kingdom's oil industry on Saturday, knocking out more than half Saudi output. Other Gulf markets also reacted negatively to the attack with Kuwait's premier index ( ) down 1.1% and Dubai stocks ( ) falling 0.8%. Saudi Basic Industries (SE: ), the kingdom's biggest petrochemicals firm, plunged 3.5% after it said it had curtailed feedback supplies by about 49%, following the attack. The drone attacks were claimed by Yemen's Houthi group, the group's military spokesman said on Al Masirah TV.
